page.title: 01Welcome to Chapel/Green.
page.content: The area around{Chapeltown}and{High {Green}has a long and fascinating history. There is a reference to{'Capeltown'}in a list of manors, produced during the reign of Edward III. High Green was traditionally a{coal mining}village, whereas Chapeltown has been involved in the{steel industry}since the 18th century. Both industries have now virtually disappeared. As a result of modern housing developments both villages have now merged together to form a{northern suburb of the City of {Shefield. Chapel/Green lies about{9 miles North {East}of the city centre and has a population of approximately{22,000. The area has easy access to the M1 and is well covered with local transport facilities.
